poem:
Title: "Morning News, Brewed Black"

In the whirlwind of rhetoric,
their words lace the dawn,
"Left-wing extremists" and "Davos man" –
claim Truss and Mogg, adorning their pawn.

72 percentages swirl in my coffee, 
unsettled by Sunak's Rwanda bet,
Perceptions stirred across the kingdom,
A peculiar breakfast—an ethical net.

Morning news, brewed black,
Reality, stark—no going back.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Liz Truss and Jacob Rees-Mogg attack ‘left-wing extremists’ and ‘Davos man’ at launch of new Tory group – UK politics live 4.58pm GMT According to a snap poll by YouGov, almost three quarters of people (72%) think it was unacceptable for Rishi Sunak to accept a £1,000 bet on the success of his Rwanda policy. Only 14% of people think that was acceptable, the poll suggests. 72% of Britons say it was unacceptable for Rishi". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Liz Truss and Jacob Rees-Mogg attack ‘left-wing extremists’ and ‘Davos man’ at launch of new Tory group – UK politics live 4.58pm GMT According to a snap poll by YouGov, almost three quarters of people (72%) think it was unacceptable for Rishi Sunak to accept a £1,000 bet on the success of his Rwanda policy. Only 14% of people think that was acceptable, the poll suggests. 72% of Britons say it was unacceptable for Rishi
